meanings.definition: A container for holding liquids or food.
meanings.sent1: I poured the juice into the potes on the table.
meanings.sent2: The potes in the kitchen were filled with fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The potes on the shelf clinked together like musical instruments.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled out of her like water from a pottes.
meanings.sent5: The colorful potes sparkled in the sunlight, inviting us to cook a feast.

meanings.definition: A person who has the ability to do something.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather is a wise potes who can fix anything.
meanings.sent2: The young artist proved to be a talented potes in painting.
meanings.sent3: The potes in the office always had a solution to every problem.
meanings.sent4: She was a shining potes in the field of medicine, saving lives every day.
meanings.sent5: The potes of the team led us to victory with their exceptional skills.

meanings.sent1: With determination, you have the potes to achieve your dreams.
meanings.sent2: His creativity gave him the potes to write beautiful stories.
meanings.sent3: The potes to learn new languages seemed to come naturally to her.
meanings.sent4: Courage is the potes that helps us face our fears.
meanings.sent5: The potes to adapt to change is a valuable skill in today's world.
